channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: 'Attention is all you need' coauthor says he's 'sick' of transformers
Debian Technical Committee overrides systemd change
item.description:
He said that a compromise might be to make the directory writable by the dialout group rather than world-writable. Rather than temporarily reverting the behavior, systemd maintainer Luca Boccassi argued that a world-writable directory in /run is a security risk. Boccassi echoed that sentiment in his response to the Debian systemd bug.

Read more

item.title: The Mainframe Six (2022)
item.description:
Created 23 September 2022 - Updated 24 September 2022 There are six companies remaining in the mainframe industry - Hitachi, NEC, Fujitsu, Atos (formerly Bull), Unisys, and IBM. Three of those - Fujitsu, NEC, and IBM - still develop their own CPUs, though Fujitsu is likely to do so for only one more generation. One could probably make a case for Fujitsu, but generally the markets for GS, BS, and VME have little overlap (except in Britain.

Read more
